popt4jlib

Class DblArray1VectorPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.DblArray1VectorPool

  • final class DblArray1VectorPool
extends java.lang.Object
    implements a thread-local pool of DblArray1Vector objects. In this way, there will be no need for invoking the new operator within the running threads requiring such objects, unless a thread at some point runs out of space in its thread-local pool. Not part of the public API.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2014

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static boolean _DO_GET_SANITY_TEST
      compile-time constant used to ensure that no object returned, was "used" at the time of return.
      private static boolean _DO_RELEASE_SANITY_TEST
      compile-time constant used to ensure no thread other than the one used in "creating" an object may release it.
      private int _maxUsedPos 
      private int _minUsedPos 
      private static int _NUMOBJS
      the maximum number of objects this pool can handle (default 10000).
      private java.util.ArrayList _pool 
      private int _vecLen

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) static DblArray1Vector getObject(int n)
      factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one.
      private DblArray1Vector getObjectFromPool()
      return an unmanaged "free" object from the pool, or null if it cannot find one.
      (package private) int getVectorsLength()
      return the length of the vectors in this pool.
      (package private) void initialize()
      only called from DblArray1VectorThreadLocalPools after this object is constructed to finish construction/initialization without escaping "this" in the constructor.
      (package private) void returnObjectToPool(DblArray1Vector ind)
      returns the argument to this pool, IFF it belongs to this pool.
      (package private) static void setPoolSize(int num)
      sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DblArray1VectorPool

        public DblArray1VectorPool(int n)
        sole constructor. Creates _NUMOBJS "empty" DblArray1Vector objects.
        Parameters:
        n - int the fixed size of each vector in the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        static DblArray1Vector getObject(int n)
        factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one. The returned object, always has its data member correctly set.
        Parameters:
        n - int array size
        Returns:
        DblArray1Vector

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        only called from DblArray1VectorThreadLocalPools after this object is constructed to finish construction/initialization without escaping "this" in the constructor.

      • returnObjectToPool

        void returnObjectToPool(DblArray1Vector ind)
        returns the argument to this pool, IFF it belongs to this pool.
        Parameters:
        ind - DblArray1Vector

      • getVectorsLength

        int getVectorsLength()
        return the length of the vectors in this pool.
        Returns:
        int

      • getObjectFromPool

        private DblArray1Vector getObjectFromPool()
        return an unmanaged "free" object from the pool, or null if it cannot find one.
        Returns:
        DblArray1Vector

      • setPoolSize

        static void setPoolSize(int num)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified. Must only be called once, before any pool is actually constructed (should only be called from the DblArray1VectorThreadLocalPools class).
        Parameters:
        num - int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is ≤ 0
